intro: Erythranthe arvensis, commonly known as the field erythranthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems covered with fine hairs and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a rough texture. Erythranthe arvensis is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
